quizzes.title: History Quiz: India and 13th
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, gondwana, jason. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these areas was struck by the Friday the 13th Storm on October 13, 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buffalo, New York

questions.question: Dinosaurs became extinct at the end of the Cretaceous due to an asteroid impact.
Horses evolved in North America but became extinct there 10,000 years ago.
What hurricane made landfall in South Florida on Friday, August 13, 2004?
This era began 65 million years ago and continues today.
Humans (Homo Sapiens) evolved from which hominid species?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Homo erectus

questions.question: How did Jason Voorhees, the son of a camp cook-turned-murderer, die in the slasher movie Friday the 13th?

options.text: He was decapitated with a machete
He was stabbed with a knife.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He drowned in a lake.

questions.question: In Spanish-speaking countries, this day, commonly referred to as Martes y trece, is considered a day of bad luck instead of Friday, the 13th.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tuesday, the 13th

questions.question: How long ago did modern humans (Homo Sapiens) appear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 250,000 years ago

questions.question: What geological epoch began following the end of the Cretaceous period?
Conditions during this epoch remained much the same as during the Paleocene.
Is it true that we are currently living through a mass extinction?

During the Cretaceous period, India separated from Gondwana and began to drift northward. Madagascar separated from India around the time the Deccan traps began to erupt, leaving India to collide with Asia. 55 million years ago, during the Cenozoic, India finally collided with southern Asia and mountain building began. What mountains are the result of this collision and are today higher than any other mountain range on Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Himalaya mountains

questions.question: On what continent did anatomically modern humans evolve?
What renowned rapper died on Friday, September 13, 1996 following a drive-by shooting?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tupak Shakur

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Period and Dinosaurs
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, eon, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: During what period did the first flowering plants evolve?
This era lasted from 251 million to 65 million years ago.
What does the word trilobite mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three lobed

questions.question: Dinosaurs were the largest terrestrial animals to have ever lived.
Who coined the term Dinosauria in 1842?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir Richard Owen

questions.question: All dinosaurs became extinct at the end of the Cretaceous period.
Allosaurus gave rise to Tyrannosaurus.
How long were dinosaurs the dominant terrestrial animals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 160 million years

questions.question: The duck bill dinosaurs are actually known as Hadrosaurs.
The fossils of this arthropod are more abundant than those of any other Burgess shale fauna.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marrella splendens

questions.question: What geological eon, era, period, and epoch are we living in today?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phanerozoic, Cenozoic, Neogene, Holocene

questions.question: A partial skeleton of this dinosaur was discovered in 1900.

Charles Darwin created a theory based on his studies aboard the HMS Beagle concerning evolution, natural selection, and the geology of the regions he studied. In what book did he publish his studies in 1859?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On the Origin of Species

questions.question: What was the predominant climate type of the Late Cretaceous period?
The name of this super-continent means All land.

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Dinosaurs and Period
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, birds, evolve. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The first mammals evolved during the Triassic period.
Did birds evolve from dinosaurs?
This pterosaur lived during the late Cretaceous and was the largest flying animal of all time with a wingspan of 39 feet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Quetzalcoatlus northropi

questions.question: The skeleton of this dinosaur was found in Mongolia entangled with a Protoceratops skeleton.
What does the word Carboniferous mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coal producing

questions.question: Pterosaurs, ichthyosaurs, plesiosaurs, placodonts, mosasaurs, etc. are dinosaurs.

During the late Silurian the first placoderms evolved. By the Devonian period they included Dunkleosteus and Phyllolepida. Did plates cover the heads of these fish which became extinct by the end of the Devonian?
The Carboniferous period is divided into two separate periods. What are they known as?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mississippian and Pennsylvanian

questions.question: The Silurian period lasted from 443 million to 417 million years ago.
During what geological period did the first dinosaurs evolve?
The level of oxygen during the Carboniferous was significantly higher than today.
The Devonian period lasted from 417 million to ___ million years ago.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 354 million years ago

questions.question: Cooksonia, one of the first terrestrial plants to have evolved a vascular system, existed during the Ordovician period.
The pubis of which of these dinosaurs points forward?
This person described both the Silurian and Permian systems during the 19th century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roderick Murchison

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Period and Life
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, period, refers. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This ocean existed throughout the Paleozoic in the northern hemisphere and is now represented by the Pacific Ocean.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Panthalassic ocean

questions.question: The first reptiles evolved during the Permian period.
What science deals with the study of ancient life, the evolution of organisms, and paleoenvironments?
By 2.7 billion years ago Stromatolites were widespread in the Precambrian seas and still exist in hypersaline areas such as Shark Bay, Australia.
What current day continent was once part of Laurentia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North America

questions.question: Anomalocaris was a predatory athropod of the Cambrian period which attained sizes of 100 cm or more.
What is a fossil?

options.text: The preserved remains or traces of an organism which is over 10,000 years old
Anything which looks of organic origin which is discovered in rocks
The preserved remains or traces of an organism

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The preserved remains or traces of an organism which is over 10,000 years old

questions.question: What term refers to a raise in biodiversity which occurred during the Cambrian period?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cambrian explosion

questions.question: A monumental mass extinction event occurred at the end of the Permian period. Approximately what percent of all life died out during this event?
Vertebrates evolved during the Cambrian period.
The oldest known rocks come from the Nuvvuagittuq greenstone belt and are approximately how old?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4200 million years old

questions.question: This geological period lasted from 543 million to 490 million years ago.
What geological period followed the Cambrian and lasted from 490 million to 443 million years ago?
Scientists generally recognized how many major mass extinctions in the history of life on Earth?
This era lasted from 543 million to 251 million years ago.

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Hogwarts and Harry Potter Series
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, appearance, carbon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This early super-continent formed during the Mesoproterozoic era.
In the Harry Potter series, Quirrell was the Muggle Studies teacher at Hogwarts, before taking the cursed Defence Against the Dark Arts position.
Name the Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher during Harrys third year who resigned after the revelation that he is a werewolf.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Remus Lupin

questions.question: It is possible to find the ages of rocks by measuring the amount of decay an unstable atom undergoes into a more stable atom.
This character makes his first appearance in Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets when he arrives at Hogwarts to take Hagrid to Azkaban.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cornelius Fudge

questions.question: Dolores Jane Umbridge is the Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher in Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire.
Carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen, phosphorus, sulfur, and energy are required by living things as well as trace amounts of numerous other elements.
When is it believed that the Earth formed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4.5 billion years ago

questions.question: What time units are shorter than epochs in geologic time scales?
In the Harry Potter series, Sybill Patricia Trelawney is the great-great-granddaughter of what celebrated seer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cassandra Trelawney

questions.question: Approximately what age are the oldest fossils now known?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3.8 billion years old

questions.question: He is the caretaker of Hogwarts and his final act in the Harry Potter series is to oversee the evacuation of younger students.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Argus Filch

questions.question: What is the largest interval of time on most geologic time scales?
In the Harry Potter series, Madame Hoochs full name is Rolanda Hooch.
What is the first name of Mad-Eye Moody in the Harry Potter series?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Book and Harry Potters
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, high-energy, sailing. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the name of the hotel Vernon stopped before going to the cabin on the sea in the first book of the Harry Potter series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Railview Hotel

questions.question: How long was Voldemorts first reign of terror?
How many fouls are there in the fictional sport Quidditch?
What is the incantation for the Leg-Binding curse as revealed in the first book of the Harry Potter series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Locomotio Mortis

questions.question: The term Penitentes refers to which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ice spikes

questions.question: How many stairs are there in the fictional Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry?
What phenomenon is caused by the collision of high-energy charged particles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aurora Borealis

questions.question: Red tide refers to algae that accumulate rapidly and cause discoloration of the surface water.
What was the name of the last student sorted in Harry Potters first year and what house was he sorted into?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blaise Zabini - Slytherin

questions.question: When was the last recorded time that all possible Quidditch fouls happened in a single game?
Who was Slytherins seeker during Harry Potters first year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Terence Higgs

questions.question: What is the name of the company that fictional character Vernon Dursley works in?
How old is Nicolas Flamel in the book that Hermione reads to Harry and Ron in Harry Potter and the Philosophers Stone?
The Death Valley is home to the Sailing Stones.
Which of these are harbingers of a coming storm?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mammatus Clouds
